intro: Finckea, commonly known as the desert lily, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaryllis family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red. The plant has a fibrous root system adapted to store water, allowing it to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, reducing water loss through transpiration. Finckea thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats.
